tables.name: osmosis_arbitrage_trades
tables.description: This table contains arbitrage trades executed in various pools within the Cosmos ecosystem. It tracks profitable trades executed by traders to take advantage of price discrepancies.

columns.name: block_height
columns.description: Block numbers indicating the progression of each block in the blockchain

columns.name: block_timestamp
columns.description: Timestamps of all blocks listed in chronological order

columns.name: tx_id
columns.description: Unique transaction identifiers on the blockchain network

columns.name: message_index
columns.description: Indices of messages contained in a particular transaction

columns.name: exec_msg_index
columns.description: Indices of executed messages within a transaction

columns.name: arb_index
columns.description: Indices of arbitrage trades executed on the network

columns.name: trader
columns.description: Address or identifier of the account performing arbitrage trades

columns.name: amount_in
columns.description: Quantities of assets input to arbitrage trades

columns.name: amount_out
columns.description: Quantities of assets output from arbitrage trades

columns.name: arbitraged_token
columns.description: Token symbols of assets being arbitraged

columns.name: profit
columns.description: Net profit earned from successful arbitrage trades

columns.name: roi
columns.description: Return on investment (ROI) for each arbitrage trade

columns.name: pool_path
columns.description: Hypsersurface paths involved in cross-chain pool trades

columns.name: n_hops
columns.description: Number of hops taken to execute cross-chain pool trades

columns.name: n_pools
columns.description: Number of pools involved in cross-chain pool trades

columns.name: ingestion_timestamp
columns.description: Timestamps when data is ingested into the dataset

tables.name: osmosis_asset_denoms
tables.description: This table provides an overview of token information from various blockchain chains in the Cosmos ecosystem, including details about their denomination, symbol, and origin. It helps users understand the different tokens available across the Cosmos ecosystem.

columns.name: chain_name
columns.description: Container for a specific blockchain in the Cosmos ecosystem

columns.name: token_denom
columns.description: Standard unit for a digital asset within a blockchain network

columns.name: token_name
columns.description: Displayable name for a digital asset on a blockchain network

columns.name: token_symbol
columns.description: Unique identifier symbol for a digital asset

columns.name: token_display
columns.description: Display format for a digital asset on blockchain UI

columns.name: token_exponent
columns.description: Scaling factor for small multiples of a token denomination

columns.name: coingecko_id
columns.description: Unique identifier for a digital asset on CoinGecko platform

columns.name: native_chain_name
columns.description: Native asset's blockchain name within Cosmos ecosystem

columns.name: native_denom
columns.description: Standard unit for the native asset within its blockchain

columns.name: token_origin
columns.description: Source chain for a token, in case of cross-chain transfer

columns.name: last_refresh
columns.description: Timestamp of the last data update for this asset record

columns.name: ingestion_date
columns.description: Timestamp of when asset data was initially ingested

columns.name: is_gov_token
columns.description: Boolean flag for tokens with governance functionality

columns.name: source
columns.description: Original data source for asset information within the table

tables.name: osmosis_block_events
tables.description: This table provides a comprehensive overview of every action and occurrence within the Cosmos blockchain ecosystem. It includes detailed information about each block's transactions, enabling the analysis of the blockchain's behavior and evolution over time.

columns.name: block_height
columns.description: Height of the block in the blockchain, incrementing with each new block

columns.name: block_timestamp
columns.description: Timestamp when the block was sealed and considered final

columns.name: event_index
columns.description: Index of events within a block, used for ordering and reference

columns.name: event_type
columns.description: Type of event occurring within a transaction or block

columns.name: event_attributes
columns.description: Associated attributes and details for the event type

columns.name: source
columns.description: Originating blockchain or network, identifies data source

columns.name: schema_version
columns.description: Version of the schema used to define the table structure

columns.name: ingestion_timestamp
columns.description: Time when the data was ingested into the analytical system

tables.name: osmosis_blocks
tables.description: Cosmos Blocks Table: This table provides information about blocks mined in the Cosmos ecosystem. It contains details such as block height and timestamp, validators, and other key metrics.

columns.name: block_height
columns.description: Sequential identifier for a block within a blockchain sequence

columns.name: block_timestamp
columns.description: Timestamp representing when a block was included in a blockchain

columns.name: chain_id
columns.description: Unique identifier for the blockchain network or chain being operated on

columns.name: proposer_address
columns.description: Beacon chain address of the proposer responsible for creating a block

columns.name: validators_hash
columns.description: Hashed list of validators participating in the block validation process

columns.name: ingestion_timestamp
columns.description: Timestamp when the block data was ingested into the database

columns.name: messages_bytes
columns.description: Total number of bytes within the block containing transaction data

columns.name: tx_count
columns.description: Count of transactions included within a block

tables.name: osmosis_delegate
tables.description: Cosmos Delegatefuscation event monitoring table. This table provides an overview of changes to the state of Cosmos validators and their stakeholders, providing valuable insights into the dynamic workings of the Cosmos network.

columns.name: block_height
columns.description: Block number marking current position within blockchain's sequence of blocks

columns.name: block_timestamp
columns.description: Timestamp when a particular block was generated or approved

columns.name: tx_hash
columns.description: Unique identifier for a specific transaction within the blockchain

columns.name: tx_index
columns.description: Index of a transaction within its containing block or message

columns.name: message_index
columns.description: Index of a message (e.g., transfer or proposal) within its block

columns.name: action_index
columns.description: Index of a specific action within a particular message or transfer

columns.name: sender
columns.description: Blockchain address associated with the sender of a transaction

columns.name: validator
columns.description: Blockchain address or account designated as a validator or stakeholder

columns.name: token_amount
columns.description: Quantity of a specific asset or token transferred during a tx

columns.name: token_denom
columns.description: Unit of account or symbol representing a specific asset or token

columns.name: new_shares
columns.description: Updated stake balance for a validator following a delegation or withdrawal

columns.name: ingestion_timestamp
columns.description: Timestamp when data was ingested or recorded in the main dataset

tables.name: osmosis_event_attributes
tables.description: This table contains various attributes of events from the cosmos blockchain ecosystem, providing insights into the transaction and block-level data.

columns.name: deprecated_warning
columns.description: Warning about obsolete data or potential incompatibility issues

columns.name: block_height
columns.description: sequential identification number of a block on the blockchain

columns.name: chain_id
columns.description: unique identifier for a blockchain network within the Cosmos ecosystem

columns.name: block_timestamp
columns.description: timestamp when a block was proposed or accepted in the blockchain

columns.name: tx_index
columns.description: index identifying transactions in a block

columns.name: event_index
columns.description: index of an event within a transaction

columns.name: event_type
columns.description: category of event occurring on the blockchain

columns.name: event_source
columns.description: source of an event, such as a smart contract or transaction

columns.name: attribute_key
columns.description: identifier or name of a specific attribute in an event

tables.name: osmosis_ibc_transfer_delays
tables.description: This table tracks IBC transfer delays within the Cosmos ecosystem, providing insights into the timelines of transaction approvals and network congestion.

columns.description: Unique identifier for a state transfer transaction on IBC network

columns.name: block_height
columns.description: Height of the block containing the transaction in the IBC network

columns.name: ack_block_height
columns.description: Height of the block containing the acknowledgment for a state transfer

columns.name: sender
columns.description: Address of the sender wallet involved in an IBC transaction

columns.name: tx_delay
columns.description: Time difference between the block arrival and acknowledgment of a state transfer in seconds

columns.name: block_timestamp
columns.description: Timestamp recorded for the block containing the transaction in IBC network

columns.name: ingestion_timestamp
columns.description: Timestamp of when the data was ingested into the database

tables.name: osmosis_ics20_acknowledgement
tables.description: This table provides information on Cosmos blockchain transactions, specifically acknowledging data within ICS-20 tokens. It includes key details about each transaction, including block height and sequence.

columns.name: action_index

columns.name: dst_channel

columns.description: Igov connection between source and destination chains

columns.name: sequence

tables.name: osmosis_ics20_receive

tables.name: osmosis_lp_cl_withdraw_position
tables.description: This table contains information about liquidity pool cross-chain withdrawal positions from the Cosmos ecosystem. It provides insights into the liquidity and token composition of these positions.

columns.name: liquidity
columns.description: Total liquidity held in the LP withdraw position before withdrawal operation

columns.description: Quantity of tokens being transferred out of a pool

columns.name: token_denom_out
columns.description: Denomination of the tokens being transferred out of a pool

columns.name: pool_id
columns.description: Identifier for a liquidity pool in a decentralized exchange

columns.name: ingestion_timestamp
columns.description: Timestamp when the data was ingested into the database

tables.name: osmosis_transactions
tables.description: This table contains transaction information from the Cosmos ecosystem, including their status, fees, and associated block information. It provides a comprehensive view of interactions within the blockchain.

columns.name: block_height
columns.description: Height of the block within the blockchain network

columns.name: chain_id
columns.description: Unique identifier for the specific blockchain network

columns.name: tx_id
columns.description: Unique identifier for the transaction within the blockchain

columns.name: tx_info
columns.description: Detailed transaction information including inputs and outputs

columns.name: tx_log_message
columns.description: Log message generated by the transaction execution

columns.name: fee
columns.description: Transaction fee paid in native network currency

columns.name: tx_code
columns.description: Transaction code result representing success or failure

columns.name: tx_index
columns.description: Index of the transaction within the block

columns.name: gas_used
columns.description: Total gas utilized by the transaction during execution

columns.name: gas_wanted
columns.description: Estimated gas amount required for transaction execution

columns.name: ingestion_timestamp
columns.description: Timestamp when the transaction data was ingested

columns.name: memo
columns.description: Optional transaction metadata stored in the TX memo field

columns.name: schema_version
columns.description: Version of the transaction schema used for data persistence

columns.name: fee_coins
columns.description: List of coins used for paying transaction fees

columns.name: fee_granter
columns.description: Account that granted the transaction fee

columns.name: fee_payer
columns.description: Account that paid the transaction fee

columns.name: gas_limit
columns.description: Maximum gas amount allowed for transaction execution

columns.name: single_sign_mode
columns.description: Indicates if transaction was executed in single-sign mode

columns.name: multi_sign_json
columns.description: JSON representation of the multi-signature transaction

columns.name: timeout_height
columns.description: Target block height for transaction execution deadline

tables.name: osmosis_tx_messages
tables.description: Cosmos Blockchain Transaction Messages: This table contains raw data from transaction messages on various Cosmos chains. It provides a detailed view of the messages exchanged between validators in the Cosmos ecosystem.

columns.name: block_height
columns.description: Height of the block in which the message was included

columns.name: chain_id
columns.description: Unique identifier of the Cosmos blockchain network

columns.name: tx_id
columns.description: Hash of the transaction containing the message

columns.name: tx_index
columns.description: Index of the transaction within the block

columns.name: message_index
columns.description: Index of the message within the transaction

columns.name: message_type
columns.description: Type of message or event within the transaction

columns.name: message
columns.description: Textual representation of the message contents

columns.name: ingestion_timestamp
columns.description: Timestamp when the message was ingested into the system

tables.name: osmosis_undelegate
tables.description: The Undelegate datasource tracks undelegation transactions in the Cosmos ecosystem. Undelegation transactions occur when a validator redelegates a portion of its staked tokens to another validator, increasing the token supply available to other validators.

columns.name: block_height
columns.description: Height of the blockchain block in which the transaction occurred

columns.name: block_timestamp
columns.description: Timestamp when the blockchain block was created or committed

columns.name: tx_hash
columns.description: Hash identifying a unique transaction on the blockchain network

columns.name: tx_index
columns.description: Index of the transaction within the block

columns.name: message_index
columns.description: Index of the message within the transaction

columns.name: action_index
columns.description: Index of the action within the message

columns.name: sender
columns.description: Address of the account initiating the token undelegation

columns.name: validator
columns.description: Public key of the validator involved in the token undelegation

columns.name: token_amount
columns.description: Amount of tokens being undelegated from the validator

columns.name: token_denom
columns.description: Denomination of the token being undelegated (e.g., ATOM)

columns.name: completion_time
columns.description: Time of completion of the token undelegation process

columns.name: ingestion_timestamp
columns.description: Timestamp when the data was ingested into the database

tables.name: osmosis_validators
tables.description: Active Cosmos validators, a crucial component of the Cosmos Network, store and validate blocks ensuring the integrity and security of the chain. Their details are vital for users to choose a validator that suits their needs.

columns.name: operator_address
columns.description: Address of the validator as delegated operator

columns.name: account_address
columns.description: Address of the validator account (delegate or delegator)

columns.name: consensus_pubkey
columns.description: Validator's public key for consensus protocol usage

columns.name: jailed
columns.description: Boolean indicating if a validator is in a jailed state

columns.name: status
columns.description: Status of a validator's operational mode

columns.name: tokens
columns.description: Total tokens staked to this validator's address

columns.name: moniker
columns.description: Validator's unique identifier in human-readable format

columns.name: identity
columns.description: Validator's identity information

columns.name: website
columns.description: Validator's official website URL

columns.name: security_contact
columns.description: Validator's security contact information

columns.name: details
columns.description: Validator-specific details or notes

columns.name: unbonding_height
columns.description: Height of block in which unbonding began

columns.name: unbonding_time
columns.description: Timestamp of unbonding operation time

columns.name: commission_rate
columns.description: Validator's base commission rate in percentage

columns.name: commission_max_rate
columns.description: Maximum allowed validator commission rate

columns.name: commission_max_change_rate
columns.description: Maximum allowed commission rate change

columns.name: commission_update_time
columns.description: Timestamp of last commission update time

columns.name: min_self_delegation
columns.description: Minimum delegation threshold in atomic units

columns.name: snapshot_height
columns.description: Height of block at which snapshot data is recorded

columns.name: snapshot_time
columns.description: Timestamp of snapshot data recording time

columns.name: ingestion_timestamp
columns.description: Timestamp of data ingestion from blockchain source

tables.name: osmosis_vote
tables.description: Cosmos Vote Data: This table contains information about votes from the various Cosmos-based blockchains. These votes are recorded on the blockchain and are used to make decisions about network upgrades and other changes.

columns.name: block_height
columns.description: Blockchain block height identifying the specific block occurrence

columns.name: block_timestamp
columns.description: Timestamp of the block indicating time of occurrence

columns.name: tx_hash
columns.description: Unique transaction hash for identification and verification

columns.name: tx_index
columns.description: Transaction index within a specific block for ordering

columns.name: message_index
columns.description: Message index identifying a message within a transaction

columns.name: action_index
columns.description: Action index within a message for ordering transactions

columns.name: sender
columns.description: Address of the entity initiating the transaction or action

columns.name: proposal_id
columns.description: Unique identifier for a governance proposal

columns.name: option
columns.description: Selected choice or action by a voter or delegate

columns.name: ingestion_timestamp
columns.description: Timestamp when the data was ingested into the dataset

tables.name: osmosis_withdraw_rewards
tables.description: This table contains records of withdrawals of rewards from validators in the Cosmos ecosystem, as processed by our ingestion service. It captures key events related to token transfers in the blockchain.

columns.name: block_height
columns.description: Identifier for a block within a blockchain, denoting ordering and uniqueness.

columns.name: block_timestamp
columns.description: Time at which a block was committed to the blockchain

columns.name: tx_id
columns.description: Unique identifier for a transaction within a blockchain

columns.name: message_index
columns.description: Index of a message within a transaction in a blockchain

columns.name: nth_action
columns.description: Index or sequence number of a specific action or event in a message

columns.name: validator
columns.description: Address of a validating node responsible for proposing/validating blocks

columns.name: moniker
columns.description: Public identifier associated with a validator node

columns.name: receiver
columns.description: Recipient's blockchain address for inter-blockchain transactions or token transfers

columns.name: token_amount
columns.description: Quantitative value representing the amount of a specific token exchanged

columns.name: token_amount_in_usdc
columns.description: Denominated value of a token in USDC (not native to blockchain)

columns.name: token_denom
columns.description: Standard unit of denomination for a particular token or asset

columns.name: ingestion_timestamp
columns.description: Time when the data was ingested into a centralized system or database
